comments.value: With the result that you get broken images displaying on the site home page and image hub.
Need a better description, have tested on live and seems to work?

I think the fix here is that any "Image section" code that displays images (like the home page) needs to look for "Image pages" and then from those pages find the related thumbnail.

It shouldn't be driven by image thumbnails but by Image pages (I think in the redesign we need to click though to the actual image page, so it will need to work like this for the redesign anyway) 

The danger on relying on images is that there may be cases where we want to delete an image page but leave the thumbnails (ie. if the thumbnail is used on news)

Those promos should list image pages not thumbnails.

In other words:

All image pages have a thumbnails
All images (thumbnail) do not necessarily have to have an Image page (it just so happens most do)

I think we should always pull image-pages. 

What if we restrict deleting anything in photos/resized and only allow deteting image pages which leads to a cleaner version of this?
Hey, what's the status of this?
new workflow should fix this.

subject: Deleting image asset does not expire Image pages
description: With the result that you get broken images displaying on the site home page and image hub.

comments.value: Seems to be happening in IE7?
I can see it but i still cannot recreate this? Its the same version on web1 and web2, tested all browsers, never came up.
I haven't been able to reproduce recently either.  If it happens again, I'll let you know immediately.
new website, new seach style

subject: Search results page seems to be formatting very strangely…
description: Seems to be happening in IE7?

not working. When is the code update going to be rolled out that will
fix it?? 

 

 

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

<hr width="100%">

Er, incorrect. Autocomplete is by and large working, and working in 
the same way as it always has. I can send you six or seven screenshots 
if you're interested, but recommend you just try typing into any of 
the other metadata inputs on that same screen: Location, Organisation, 
Theme, etc.

It looks to me as if the hot fix we shipped yesterday in response to 
the problem you were having with renaming tags has introduced a new 
bug in the page editor tag autocomplete. This is the problem with 
shipping fixes in a hurry, of course. You'd think we'd know better by 
now! However, answers your second question: it will be rolled out when 
it's ready.

Regards
Michael

>

But it IS broken for all the free text tagging. Which means that people
will create new free text tags which won't relate to any of our previous
tags. Which is rather a bummer. I can send you quite a few screenshots
of that, too. :-)

Sadly, I'm not sure "when it's ready" is going to make many people very
happy. Can you at least give an approximation? "Tomorrow", "Next
week", "Next month"? For the new site we're going to be creating (and
tagging) lots of new pages. We'll need it for that.

Thanks


Liz Goulding
New Media Producer
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297
Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000
www.london2012.com
www.twitter.com/london2012team

-----Original Message-----
From: Michael Kowalski [mailto:michael@kitsite.com] 
Sent: 30 September 2009 15:30
To: Liz Goulding
Cc: support@kitsite.com; support@postcms.zendesk.com
Subject: Re: autocomplete

Er, incorrect. Autocomplete is by and large working, and working in 
the same way as it always has. I can send you six or seven screenshots 
if you're interested, but recommend you just try typing into any of 
the other metadata inputs on that same screen: Location, Organisation, 
Theme, etc.

It looks to me as if the hot fix we shipped yesterday in response to 
the problem you were having with renaming tags has introduced a new 
bug in the page editor tag autocomplete. This is the problem with 
shipping fixes in a hurry, of course. You'd think we'd know better by 
now! However, answers your second question: it will be rolled out when 
it's ready.

Regards
Michael

comments.value: Could be an IE only problem?

Steps to repro:
- select multiple comments via checkbox
- apply some action, eg. approve/reject
- see if applied to all selected items

just tried it again, in IE7 - i had three comments with the box ticked, and when i clicked 'approve' the rollover said 'approve selected comments', but the only one that seemed to actually be approved was the one that was also highlighted blue (i couldn't get more than one to be blue)

comments.value: On the ceremonies page there’s nothing in the promo boxes at the bottom, but they’re displaying the red cross in a box…I think they shouldn’t appear at all. Could you investigate?

This is happening because the template for that page expects to see a couple of subsections under Ceremonies (Getting Ready, Games Time, and Legacy), and it's trying to create links through to those sections. If you look at, say, Our Plans/Transport you'll see this working. Do you know if those sections used to exist and were deleted at some point?
I don't think they did for the Ceremonies page. can they be hidden?

subject: Galleries and unique images
description: When adding a picture with a name that already exists in a gallery to a gallery we should add a number to the end of the name ie. ( #1... )

comments.value: This looks like a problem in the workflow

Need to check path in workflow, and if it lives in /galleries/ then republish the index page for that section.

* check that live and dev workflow aren't out of sync first

When an image gets added to a gallery it now publishes the Gallery index if this index had been published before. ( It also updates the navInclude for the image hub and publishes the image hub itself )

subject: Adding image to gallery does not trigger republish
description: This looks like a problem in the workflow

comments.value:
In this case it’s Liz'  But it’s in the page url.  Any way it could … not be? 
http://www.london2012.com/blog/contributors/liz-goulding.php

(check the name showing is surname not simply username)

It's using the 'name' field when it sets up that page, and not 'display-name' or a username - at least in all the tests I tried. Do you know where it's creating that page from? I had a quick look in workflow and web services and couldn't see anything. If you don't I'll have a proper trawl through them later. 

Actually, from a quick scan, it looks like newer pages have the name as their title and older ones have a string of numbers. This is based on a tiny sample! Might this have changed when we switched from /cms/ to /kit/
I've amended all of the existing contributor pages so that their names don't appear in the url. I'm looking into the cause of it now!
